position.marginalia_text: Cadwallo Rex Britonu[m] a[nn]o - 620 fert 630 Cadvaladrus Rex Britonum a[nno] - 667 - 679 Ceduualla Rex Westsaxonu[m] - 673 Ine Rex Westsaxonu[m] - 675 Idem Radulfus Cadualladrus filius Caduallonis, cum 12 annis regnasset incidit in infirmitatem. Britannia, famessimia sup[p]lementa, consumpta est. Cadualladrus cu[m] navigio miserabili posijt Alanum Rege[m] Armoricoro[rum] &. A papa Sergio confirmatus est & Mortuus est a[nn]o 689. Ivor filius Cadualladri Saxones infestauat 80 annis &.

marginalia.translation: Cadwallon, king of the Britons from 620 to 630. Cadwaladr, king of the Britons from 667-679. Caedwalla, king of West-Saxony from 673. Ine, king of West-Saxony from 675. Radulfus the same. Cadwaladr son of Cadwallo, after having reigned for twelve years, fell into sickness. Britain, reinforced by famine, was consumed. Cadwaladr went with a miserable ship to Alanus king of the Armoricans. It is confirmed by pope Sergius I that he died in the year 689. Ivor, son of Cadwaladr, attacked the Saxons for 80 years.

position.marginalia_text: ] Hinc r[o?]poni magna co[n]troversia p[os]t de ipsis duob[us] sepenum er[??] confuse no[m]i[n]as tis &: d[??]ersitatu [??]poru[?] q[u]o regna[???] reper[???]

J[ohn] D[ee]. Controversia videri p[os]t de filio Cadovalladri, eo op quida Idwallum posuit, alij vero Ivor. At Conte[???] quoniam illi [deleted] nomen erat, Idwall Iwrch. Unde quida[m?] [??] Ivores ponuit Ivor. errore facile: e[??] alij nomen prima??? Idwall res[?[e[?]:&.
